greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A084937 mod 3.
comment: By definition of A084937 this cannot contain two consecutive 0's. So the 0's divide this sequence into runs of 1's and 2's. In the first 100000 terms the following runs of 1's and 2's appear: 11, 12, 21, 22, 111, 112, 121, 122, 211, 212, 221, 222, 1112, 1121, 1122, 1212, 1221, 2111, 2112, 2121, 2211, 2212, 2221. There is no obvious structure. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 07 2014
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
program: a249603 = flip mod 3 . a084937  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 04 2014
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 03 2014
